content: Oh wow...apparently POP does not download "SENT" / "Sent Items" folder on Thunderbird, as per here....
creator: jsid001

content:
POP only downloads the Inbox, and messages sent from the account are stored locally. To download the Sent and other folders that are seen in webmail, the account must be IMAP.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Convert_a_POP_account_to_a_IMAP_account

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1417298#answer-1588949
creator: sfhowes

content: My inference is that you are referring to threading. highlight the folder, then click View>sort by and tick 'unthreaded' from the menu bar. If you do not see the menu bar, press the alt key.

creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
Hi David, I believe In the majority of the cases the classification of "Junk or not" happens on your IMAP server and Thunderbird, just moves the messages in the appropriate folder.

Thunderbird uses an adaptive filter that learns from your actions which messages are legitimate and which are junk.

You can train it not to do that by using the approach listed here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: shopov.bogomil

content: Puoi spiegare esattamente come fai a rimuovere l'account?
creator: @next

content: Certo vado sull'accout, Impostazioni, Azioni Account, Eliminazione account, Elimina Grazie
creator: sergio.chiarla

content:
Ok, prova ad eliminare l'account mettendo prima Thunderbird in modalità offline:

  1. premi Alt sulla tastiera per rendere visibile la barra dei menu
  2. vai nel menu File > Non in linea
  3. scegli la voce Lavora non in linea

Procedi quindi all'eliminazione dell'account come hai già fatto, quindi chiudi e poi riavvia Thundebird.
creator: @next

content: I do not know why that option does not appear, but you may want to read this article: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Import_.pst_files Thunderbird does not have the ability to import pst files alone, but is dependent on Outlook being installed on the same PC. I cannot give you more information than that, although if you do a web search, there are several options to convert PST to Thunderbird, such as this one: https://www.wikihow.com/Import-a-PST-File-to-Thunderbird

content: When you change an SMTP server and then it appears to change all SMTP servers, that is an indication that you are using one server for all accounts. Each account needs its own SMTP server. They may be identical except for the email address. I encourage also placing the email address in the Description field for the SMTP server settings to simplify the process of linking the account to the associated SMTP server.
creator: davidsk

content: I tried that, but it failed. I simply found that all the server "description" changed to the new email address and password rather than just the one I changed. That is that within Thunderbird the server smtp.ionos.co.uk only seemed to accept one user. Now, it may be that the problem is the accounts already exist, but obviously I do not want to lose all my past emails by closing the old accounts and opening a new one. What is needed is to add a new server in a standalone entry (I cannot find anywhere to do that). That way I could add the" three" servers,with different descriptors, logon user (ie domain) add & password, but the same server address and point the other email addresses (keeping domains matched) to the appropriate one. If its possible, any chance of a step-by-step if this can be done?
creator: farm1

content: - click to account settings pane - scroll down left side, past the account name to 'Outgoing Servers SMTP' and click that. It will show all SMTP servers. From there, you can click 'add' and create new SMTP servers. Be sure to enter exactly the same info as on the one that works, except for email address. Enter that also in description field for documentation. - once you have created the SMTP severs, click each account pane and the bottom line is where you specify the appropriate SMTP server.
creator: davidsk
